intro: Euphrasia leveilleana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia leveilleana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
